page.title: 08MR. BLUNDELL 1
page.content:
Mr Blundell was born in 1904. There were four children in his family and he lived in five different houses in Read. There was a farm and a football pitch where now there are houses.
He went to school in Read when the school consisted of only the hall and one classroom. Badly behaved children got the cane. If you pulled your cuffs over your hand you got a harder strike. He went to Sunday School and church three times on Sundays.
Mr Blundell started half-time work at the age of twelve. While his friends worked in the cotton mill he worked with his father in the shoe shjop where they made clogs with wooden soles. (Continued on page 9).
